verses.text: 耶和華呼叫摩西，從會幕裡對摩西說：

words.note: The personal name of God in the Old Testament.
The portable sanctuary of the Israelites.

verses.heading: Introduction to the Sacrificial Regulations

verses.text: 「你要告訴以色列人說：如果你們中間有人把供物獻給耶和華，就要從牛群羊群中獻家畜為供物。

words.note: Descendants of Jacob, the people of Israel.
An item presented as a religious offering.

verses.text: 他的供物若是獻牛作燔祭，就要把一頭沒有殘疾的公牛，牽到會幕門口，就可以在耶和華面前蒙悅納。

words.note: A more formal or literary 'if'.
Crucial requirement for sacrifices to be acceptable.
蒙 (méng) often means to receive a favor or blessing in biblical context.

verses.heading: Burnt Offering Regulations: Animal from the Herd

verses.text: 他要按手在燔祭牲的頭上，燔祭就蒙悅納，可以為他贖罪。

words.note: A symbolic act of identification or blessing in biblical rituals.
The animal designated for a burnt offering.
To make amends or reconciliation for sin.

verses.text: 他要在耶和華面前宰殺那公牛，亞倫子孫作祭司的，要奉上血，潑在會幕門口祭壇的四周。

words.note: Refers to killing animals, especially for food or sacrifice.
A person authorized to perform religious rituals.
Connects 'Aaron's descendants who serve as priests'.
A structure on which sacrifices are offered.

verses.text: 那人要剝去燔祭牲的皮，把燔祭牲切成塊子。

words.note: Indicates intention or requirement.
Specifically an animal for a burnt offering.
'Ba' construction for emphasis on outcome.

verses.text: 亞倫子孫作祭司的，要把炭火放在祭壇上，把柴排列在火上；

words.note: One who manages sacrifices.
Turns phrase 'Aaron's descendants acting as priests' into a noun phrase.
Positional particle indicating location.

verses.text: 亞倫子孫作祭司的，要把肉塊和頭，以及脂肪，排列在祭壇炭火上的木柴上面。
那人又要用水洗淨內臟和腿；祭司就把這一切全獻在祭壇上焚燒，作為燔祭，就是獻給耶和華馨香的火祭。

words.note: Used for emphasis or explanation.
The Hebrew name for God.
Often used in biblical context for pleasing aroma to God.
An offering presented by fire.

verses.text: 「人的供物若是獻羊作燔祭，不論是綿羊或是山羊，總要獻一隻沒有殘疾的公羊。

words.note: Things offered to God or a superior.
Generic term, context specifies sheep or goat.
Lit. 'cotton sheep'.
Lit. 'mountain sheep'.
Refers to physical imperfections, crucial for sacrifices.

verses.heading: Animal from the Flock

verses.text: 他要在耶和華面前，在祭壇的北面，把羊宰殺；亞倫子孫作祭司的，要把羊血潑在祭壇的四周。

words.note: A transliteration of the Hebrew divine name.
Often used in ritual or large-scale animal killing.
One who manages sacrifices.
Turns the preceding phrase into a noun, 'those who are priests'.

verses.text: 那人要把燔祭牲切成塊子；祭司就把肉塊、頭和脂肪，排列在祭壇炭火上的木柴上面；

words.note: Verb-complement construction: 'cut' + 'become'.

verses.text: 那人又要用水洗淨內臟和腿，祭司就把這一切全獻在祭壇上焚燒，作為燔祭，就是獻給耶和華馨香的火祭。

words.note: Verb-complement indicating a result: wash until clean.

words.definition: to burn, to set on fire
words.note: Often implies ritual or complete burning.
Verb-complement indicating direction: 'offer' + 'to'.
Often used for offerings pleasing to God.

verses.text: 「人若是獻鳥類為燔祭作耶和華的供物，就要獻斑鳩或雛鴿。

words.note: A specific type of dove often used in offerings.

verses.heading: From the Birds

verses.text: 祭司要把鳥帶到祭壇那裡，扭下牠的頭來，焚燒在祭壇上；又把鳥血擠出來，流在祭壇的壁上；

words.note: Verb-complement indicating motion towards a destination.
Verb-complement indicating downward or removal action.
Indicates motion towards the speaker/center, or completion.

words.definition: to burn, to set on fire

words.note: Verb-complement-directional indicating 'squeeze' with direction 'out' and motion 'towards'.

verses.text: 又要除掉鳥的嗉囊和髒物，丟在祭壇東邊，倒灰的地方。

words.note: Refers to a bird's gullet, specifically in Levitical sacrifices.

verses.text: 然後要拿著兩個翅膀把鳥撕裂，只是不可撕斷。祭司要把牠放在祭壇，在炭火上的木柴上面焚燒，作為燔祭，就是獻給耶和華馨香的火祭。」

words.note: A sacrifice completely consumed by fire.
Often used in the Bible for sacrifices pleasing to God.
